skill.name: spec-driven-development
skill.description: Spec-Driven Development (SDD) methodology based on GitHub's SpecKit. Use for structured AI-assisted development with constitutional governance, phased workflows, and multi-agent coordination. Implements 7-phase process from constitution to implementation.
skill.summary: Spec-Driven Development (SDD) methodology based on GitHub's SpecKit. Use for structured AI-assisted ...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown describing a development methodology. No network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Managing complex AI-assisted projects without clear structure leads to inconsistent results and missed requirements. Spec-Driven Development provides a 7-phase workflow with constitutional governance to ensure quality, traceability, and parallel execution across multiple AI agents.
actual_capabilities: Guide AI assistants through 7-phase development workflow
Create structured specifications with acceptance criteria
Generate actionable task breakdowns with dependency tracking
Enable parallel execution across multiple AI agents
limitations: Does not execute code or create files directly
Requires human oversight for implementation decisions
Best suited for software projects, not all use cases
Methodology must be followed sequentially for best results

use_cases.title: Enterprise project governance
use_cases.description: Establish consistent development standards across teams with constitutional principles and quality gates

use_cases.title: Multi-agent coordination
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple AI assistants working on the same project with parallel work streams and dependency tracking

use_cases.title: Requirements traceability
use_cases.description: Maintain clear connection between user stories, specifications, and implementation tasks

prompt_templates.title: Initialize project
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the Spec-Driven Development methodology to start a new [PROJECT_TYPE] project. Begin with Phase 0 (Project Initialization) to set up the .specify/ directory structure and Phase 1 (Constitution) to establish governance principles. The core principles should include: Library-First, CLI Interface Mandate, Test-First Imperative, and Simplicity.

prompt_templates.title: Create feature spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Phase 2 (Specification) of Spec-Driven Development to create a detailed feature specification for [FEATURE_NAME]. Include: feature branch name (2-4 words), user scenarios with priorities P1-P3, acceptance criteria in Given/When/Then format, functional requirements (FR-XXX), key entities, and measurable success criteria. Focus on WHAT and WHY, not HOW.

prompt_templates.title: Break down tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Phase 6 (Task Breakdown) to create an actionable task list from the plan for [FEATURE_NAME]. Structure tasks with: checkbox, sequential ID, optional parallel marker (||), story label (P1/P2/P3), file path, and clear description. Group by user story for independent implementation. Include foundational phase before any user story work.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze artifacts
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Phase 5 (Analysis) on the [FEATURE_NAME] artifacts. Analyze spec.md, plan.md, and tasks.md for: duplications, ambiguities, underspecified items, and constitution conflicts. Report findings with severity ranking. Maximum 50 high-signal issues.

output_examples.input: Apply Spec-Driven Development to create specifications for a user authentication feature
output: Feature specification created with 3 P1 scenarios, 2 P2 scenarios
Acceptance criteria defined in Given/When/Then format
Research and planning phases ready for execution

best_practices: Establish the constitution in Phase 1 before any specification work to ensure consistent governance
Resolve all clarifications in Phase 3 before starting planning to avoid rework
Mark tasks with parallelization markers (||) when they have no dependencies to enable concurrent execution
anti_patterns: Skipping clarification phase and proceeding with ambiguous specifications
Including implementation details in the specification phase
Starting user story work before the foundational phase is complete

faq.question: Which AI coding tools support Spec-Driven Development?
faq.answer: SDD works with Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, Codex, Gemini, Cursor, and 15+ AI coding agents. The methodology is tool-agnostic.

faq.question: How long should each phase take?
faq.answer: Phase duration varies by project complexity. Foundation and specification phases typically take 1-2 days for medium features. Implementation time depends on task count.

faq.question: Can SDD be used for existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Start with Phase 0 to create .specify/ structure, then apply constitution to current practices. Backfill specifications for key features incrementally.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this methodology?
faq.answer: SDD is a documentation and process methodology. It does not execute code or access external systems. All artifacts stay within your project directory.

faq.question: What if specifications change mid-project?
faq.answer: Revisit the clarification phase to address changes. Update spec.md, then re-run planning and task breakdown. The methodology supports iterative refinement.

faq.question: How does SDD compare to agile or waterfall?
faq.answer: SDD combines structured phases like waterfall with agile principles. It provides gates and quality checks while enabling parallel execution and iterative refinement.
